doc.after: With regard to the International Space Station (ISS) ESA is not represented by all of its member states:[89] 10 of the 21 ESA member states currently participate in the project.[note 1] ESA is taking part in the construction and operation of the ISS with contributions such as Columbus, a science laboratory module that was brought into orbit by NASA's STS-122 Space Shuttle mission and the Cupola observatory module that was completed in July 2005 by Alenia Spazio for ESA. The current estimates for the ISS are approaching â¬100 billion in total (development, construction and 10 years of maintaining the station) of which ESA has committed to paying â¬8 billion.[90] About 90% of the costs of ESA's ISS share will be contributed by Germany (41%), France (28%) and Italy (20%). German ESA astronaut Thomas Reiter was the first long-term ISS crew member.
